clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Attitudes Towards Organ Donation in Singapore
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Attitudes Towards Organ Donation in Singapore

brief_summary.textblock: One survey is conducted. Exploring the effect of different messages on family members' decision making on organ donation.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators intend to examine the impact of nudging interventions in the form of a vignette designed to emulate the standard procedure of informing family members of a loved one's unfavourable prognosis. The investigators intend to examine the effect of the interventions on the eventual decision-making process of the family member.

primary_outcome.measure: Binary survey item - Preferred option for mother's situation
primary_outcome.description: A binary choice between 'Turning off life support' and 'Wait and see' which measures the efficacy of nudges on ultimate decision-making.

primary_outcome.measure: 10cm line scale survey item - Willingness for participant's mother's organs to be donated under brain death
primary_outcome.description: A 10cm line scale will be given and participants will be asked to put a cross on the line that corresponds to what they are feeling. This will measure their willingness for their mother's organs to be donated under the conditions of brain death.

secondary_outcome.measure: 10cm line scale survey item - Willingness for participant's mother's organs to be donated under cardiac death
secondary_outcome.description: A 10cm line scale will be given and participants will be asked to put a cross on the line that corresponds to what they are feeling. This will measure their willingness for their mother's organs to be donated under the conditions of cardiac death.

secondary_outcome.measure: 10cm line scale survey item - Willingness for participant's own organs to be donated under brain death
secondary_outcome.description: A 10cm line scale will be given and participants will be asked to put a cross on the line that corresponds to what they are feeling. This will measure their willingness to donate their own organs under conditions of brain death.

arm_group.description: Vignette is framed in a particular manner
Vignette contains extra information about norms
Vignette contains extra information about norms and is framed in a particular manner.

intervention.description: Vignette is framed in a way that nudges participant to leave a legacy
Vignette informs the participant that most people choose an option to try to nudge participant into choosing that option as well

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Above age 21
- Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below age 21
- Non-citizens
- Not able to make decisions for self
